title: Christina Aguilera channels Morticia at the Los Angeles premiere for new Addams Family movie
text:
She sings the theme song for The Addams Family movie.

And Christina Aguilera got into character for the animated film's Los Angeles premiere on Sunday, giving Morticia Addams a run for her money with her incredible look.

The singer channeled the matriarch of Halloween's favourite family as she hit the purple carpet at Westfield Century City AMC.

Getting into character: Christina Aguilera chanelled Morticia Addams for the premiere of The Addams Family animated movie at Westfield Century City AMC in Los Angeles on Sunday

Christina, 38, went got a gothic vibe in her floor length black dress, with racy lace-up detail on her cleavage.

She added a black manicure and vampy eye makeup, while rocking platinum blonde locks with a short, blunt fringe.

The singer posed up a storm on the purple carpet, pouting for the camera before posing with her fiancé Matthew Rutler and her two children, Max, 11, and Summer, 5.

Morticia lookalike: Christina, 38, went got a gothic vibe in her floor length black dress, with racy lace-up detail on her cleavage

Feeling it: She added a black manicure and vampy eye makeup, while rocking platinum blonde locks with a short, blunt fringe

The musician sings the song Haunted Heart for the film, which features the voice of Charlize Theron as Morticia.

The character has previously been played by Carolyn Jones in the 1960s television series and by Anjelica Huston in The Addams Family (1991) and its sequel Addams Family Values (1993).

The new animated film also stars Oscar Isaac as Morticia's husband Gomez and Chloe Grace as daughter Wednesday. An inspired bit of casting sees Snoop Dogg voice Cousin Itt.

Iconic: Morticia has previously been played by Anjelica Huston (right) in The Addams Family (1991) and its sequel Addams Family Values (1993)

Strike a pose: The star added flawless makeup, with heavily lined eyes and glossy lips

New music: The musician sings the song Haunted Heart for the film, which features the voice of Charlize Theron as Morticia

It's a busy time for Christina, who last week took to Instagram to announce the next leg of her residency at Zappos Theater, called the Xperience.

The next installment of Aguilera's Xperience residency will unfold between Christmas and New Year's, with a fourth leg scheduled to run through early March of next year.

The Stripped hitmaker previously teased that her residence show would be a multi-sensory experience with elements of 'mother nature.'

'This is the next chapter in something new, exciting, creative and epic for my fans,' she said.

'I'm such a visual person and I've been acquiring all these inspirations. You know I love a theme and a concept and I'm creating a specific world for this show.'
description: The singer channeled the matriarch of Halloween's favourite family as she hit the purple carpet at Westfield Century City AMC.
